ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing techniques
I improved my writing on both a craft and organizational level.
Analyzing the craft of the modern literary journalism essay.

I was able to understand at a deeper level what writing techniques help to make a piece more engaging, powerful, and enjoyable to read. I also discovered the ability of creative non-fiction to convey some stories and arguments more strongly than academic papers.
Reading to analyze writer style and prose. I also learned how to write in a much more applicable manner
I became a much more observant reader and better writer. Writing now comes more easily to me, and my writing is more artful and precise.
I learned a lot about reading critically and writing.

Learned how to analyze and write the modern essay. Learned a litany of techniques to improve my writing and spent lots of time working to incorporate techniques from the essays we read into my own work.
I learned to read closely for rhetorical strategies and non-fiction craft, and to write common non-fiction essay forms (the personal essay, the profile, and the humor essay).

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - great selection of readings, clear and thorough feedback on essays, strong variety of writing styles explored

Weaknesses - Borderline grades (A/A-) can be confusing to interpret

Strengths: interesting reads, good discussions, lots of learning
Weaknesses: readings much longer than what you have to write so development of story in many less words is tough
The strengths were the diversity of readings and the fact that it challenged me to write in areas outside of my comfort zone. This course did not have many weaknesses.

Strengths: awesome and very caring Professor, engaging content, lots of opportunities to grow as a writer

Weakness: none really!

This course was incredibly strong. It was well-planned and enjoyable tot attend. My one suggestion is that perhaps the lowest essay score could be dropped in grace calculations, because I though my essays from the beginning of the year sort of dragged down my grade, even though I had to try harder to write at that point.
Strengths- So many interesting readings. A very high level of engagement felt natural in the seminar. It felt like I class I was there to learn from and not necessarily take a grade from.

Strengths: Engaged professor, great readings, enjoyable seminar style, detailed instructor feedback, improved my writing immensely
Weaknesses: Many deadlines and assignments (there are small writing assignments on top of readings and almost weekly paper deadlines), was encouraged to write in the style of the professor rather than develop my own voice

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would. English 120 is a solid Writing course, and each assignment offers you the opportunity to explore new styles, craft moves, and forms.
Yes! Take it with Pam! I hated writing until I took this course. Its super interesting and is a type of writing that comes naturally for many people.
Absolutely!
Yes, I would recommend this class to any student that wants to improve their writing in any capacity. The skills that I learned are translatable to many other classes.
Yes! Pam is so awesome. She puts the needs of her students first and makes herself available to her students.

I would highly recommend this course to another student who is looking to try writing in a mode that is not just the formulaic academic essay I was taught in high school. The readings were entertaining, not too long, and helpful in terms of reading for craft. The class had relatively constant work, but I would say a manageable amount.
Yes! I think this was a great course. It was well organized and well taught.
A million times yes. This is my favorite class I've taken at Yale. Pam is amazing and you'll enjoy your semester.

I would recommend this course because it helped me to become a better writer and thinker. I enjoyed the in class discussions and received tons of detailed feedback from the professor. The essays were carefully chosen and provided models for non-fiction essay writing. I would caution that the course is a lot of work (more than many of my other classes combined).
